titlestmt.titleproper: John A. Benjamin Papers Addendum Biomed.0001A
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Biomedical Library staff, 2011.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-03 16:32:17 -0700.

did.abstract: Letters, photographs, memorabilia, and personal records that supplement the materials in UCLA Biomedical Library's Manuscript Collection #1: "John A. Benjamin papers, 1925-1994".
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John A. Benjamin papers - addendum (Collection 1A). Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library History and Special Collections for the Sciences, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by UCLA Biomedical Library staff.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: In August, 2004, John A. Benjamin, son of the original collector, deposited with the UCLA Biomedical Library an additional small box of letters, photographs, and a scrapbook to be integrated into the main collection of Benjamin papers previously donated to the library.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Biographical data on Dr. Benjamin can be found in the introductory material to the finding aid for "John A. Benjamin Papers", which is available online.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This addendum consists mostly of personal items and photographs. Some materials pertain to Dr. Benjamin's interest in the history of urology and medicine, but almost nothing is added to the record of his research or clinical work.
The series-subseries organization of the original large collection has been retained, but only those categories for which there are new materials are listed here.

The collection is organized into the following series:
Series 1. Early Study and Research.. 2 folders
Series 2. Research, Teaching, Patient Care -- Urogenital System.. 2 folders
Series 3. Research -- Historical and Bibliographic.. 5 folders
Series 6. Personal Materials.. 5 folders
Series 7. Non-Print Materials.. 7 folders

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: UCLA BIOMEDICAL LIBRARY HISTORY AND SPECIAL COLLECTIONS FOR THE SCIENCES. Manuscript Collection #1: "John A. Benjamin papers".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: evaluation of the 1933 Rockefeller interns (including Benjamin) and the general program, by North Carolina State Board of Health member, 1933; correspondence between J. A. Benjamin (son) and Rockefeller Univ., 1993

did.unittitle: School of Medicine graduation day, The Johns Hopkins University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: copy of remarks made by Professor Jacob H. Hollander to President Ames, plus cover letter from Prof. Hollander to Benjamin

did.unittitle: Research, Teaching, Patient Care -- Urogenital System.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: certificate of membership in The Society for Pediatric Urology

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: five short 8mm film strips of dog and human bladder during urination, with enlarged photo positives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: memorabilia which belonged to Dr. van der Poel, from the 25th Anniversary Dinner of the Association, 1911

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: photo of letter from Dr. John Macintyre, Glasgow, to Prof. Röntgen, 1896; photo of first page of Röntgen article "Ueber eine neue Art von Strahlen", 1895

did.unittitle: History of Medicine and Medical Books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: portraits of: Bartholin, Erasmus, 1625-1698; Bartholin, Thomas, 1616-1680; Bullein, William, d. 1576; Cheselden, William, 1688-1752; Denonvilliers, Charles-Pierre, 1808-1872; Harvey, William, 1578-1657; Pattison, Granville Sharp, 1791-1851

did.unittitle: Letter from M. F. Ashley Montagu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: concerns Benjamin's admiration of Montagu's book about Edward Tyson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: photocopy of a partial plate from the 1807 folio edition, with notes on the verso concerning Bozzini and Dr. Benjamin's acquisition of this work

did.unittitle: Elementary and high school records, Salmon, Idaho.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: report cards, promotion certificates from 6th grade through high school graduation

did.unittitle: University of California, Southern Branch records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: report cards, transcript; fee receipts

did.physdesc: 8.25" x 11.5", hard cover, loose-leaf; very brittle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: miscellaneous items, including some correspondence, newspaper and magazine clippings, poetry, etc.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: USE PHOTOCOPY (next folder) INSTEAD OF ORIGINAL

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: photocopy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: UCLA Alumni Association, 1980; The Johns Hopkins Associates, 1982

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Elmer Belt, 1893-1980 and George Whipple, 1878-1976; Campeti, Frank L.; Graham, James, 6th Duke of Montrose, 1878-1954; Hinman, Frank Jr., 1920-1999; Macintyre, John, 1859-1928; Ramsey, George H.S., 1894-1965; Scott, John; Thomson, William, 1st Baron Kelvin (Lord Kelvin), 1824-1907; Watson, James Sibley Jr., 1894-1982; Weinberg, Sydney A., 1910-1977; 35mm slides of Graham, Kelvin, Macintyre, Scott; 16mm film frames of "Early x-ray photo of soft tissue, 1896" by John Macintyre

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: three photographs of men

did.unittitle: Group pictures: The Johns Hopkins University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: four photographs, two negatives

odd.head: General note
odd.p: identified are John Eckert and Dave Sprong; Dr. Benjamin appears in all photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: group photograph, including Dr. Benjamin

did.unittitle: Group pictures: Strong Memorial Hospital, Rochester, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: four photographs, circa 1943, including Surgical Staff and Senior Staff; four photographs, circa 1957, 1967, 1969, 1970, of Urology Group

odd.head: General note
odd.p: identified in one group: Larry Parlow, Harry Miller, Don McDonald, W. W. Scott, Irwin Frank, Herbert Boyd, Abe Crockett; Dr. Benjamin in all photos

did.unittitle: Annual meeting, American Urological Association, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
